definition:
Suzanne is a content marketer, writer, and fact-checker. She holds a Bachelor of Science in Finance degree from Bridgewater State University and helps develop content strategies.

The currency of Oman. The Omani rial is broken into smaller units, called baisa, and is found in both coin and banknote form. It is managed by the Central Bank of Oman.

The Omani rial was created during the early 1970s, as a replacement to theIndian rupeeand Maria Teresa Thaler.It was part of a modernization effort, undertaken in the wake of a rebellion. The currency is pegged to theU.S. dollar, though the rate was adjusted in 1986.

Central Bank of Oman. "Currency." Accessed March 22, 2021.

Central Bank of Oman. "Currency Museum." Accessed March 22, 2021.

Central Bank of Oman. "The Fixed Peg of the RO to the US Dollar." Accessed March 22, 2021
